014package org.jdbi.v3.core.result;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Type;
017import java.sql.ResultSet;
018import java.sql.SQLException;
019import java.util.Map;
020import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
021import java.util.function.BiFunction;
022import java.util.function.Supplier;
023import java.util.stream.Collector;
024import java.util.stream.Stream;
025
026import org.jdbi.v3.core.collector.ElementTypeNotFoundException;
027import org.jdbi.v3.core.collector.NoSuchCollectorException;
028import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.Configurable;
029import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericType;
030import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.ColumnMapper;
031import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.GenericMapMapperFactory;
032import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.MapMapper;
033import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.NoSuchMapperException;
034import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.RowMapper;
035import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.RowViewMapper;
036import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.SingleColumnMapper;
037import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.reflect.BeanMapper;
038import org.jdbi.v3.core.qualifier.QualifiedType;
039import org.jdbi.v3.core.result.internal.RowViewImpl;
040import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementContext;
041
042/**
043 * Provides access to the contents of a {@link ResultSet} by mapping to Java types.
044 */
045public interface ResultBearing {
046    /**
047     * Returns a ResultBearing backed by the given result set supplier and context.
048     *
049     * @param resultSetSupplier result set supplier
050     * @param ctx the statement context
051     * @return a ResultBearing
052     */
053    static ResultBearing of(Supplier<ResultSet> resultSetSupplier, StatementContext ctx) {
054        return new ResultBearing() {
055            @Override
056            public <R> R scanResultSet(ResultSetScanner<R> mapper) {
057                try {
058                    return mapper.scanResultSet(resultSetSupplier, ctx);
059                } catch (SQLException e) {
060                    throw new ResultSetException("Error reading result set", e, ctx);
061                }
062            }
063        };
064    }
065
066    /**
067     * Invokes the mapper with a result set supplier, and returns the value returned by the mapper.
068     * @param mapper result set scanner
069     * @param <R> result type returned by the mapper.
070     * @return the value returned by the mapper.
071     */
072    <R> R scanResultSet(ResultSetScanner<R> mapper);
073
074    /**
075     * Maps this result set to a {@link ResultIterable} of the given element type.
076     *
077     * @param type the type to map the result set rows to
078     * @param <T>  the type to map the result set rows to
079     * @return a {@link ResultIterable} of the given type.
080     * @see Configurable#registerRowMapper(RowMapper)
081     * @see Configurable#registerRowMapper(org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.RowMapperFactory)
082     * @see Configurable#registerColumnMapper(org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.ColumnMapperFactory)
083     * @see Configurable#registerColumnMapper(ColumnMapper)
084     */
085    default <T> ResultIterable<T> mapTo(Class<T> type) {
086        return mapTo(QualifiedType.of(type));
087    }
088
089    /**
090     * Maps this result set to a {@link ResultIterable} of the given element type.
091     *
092     * @param type the type to map the result set rows to
093     * @param <T>  the type to map the result set rows to
094     * @return a {@link ResultIterable} of the given type.
095     * @see Configurable#registerRowMapper(RowMapper)
096     * @see Configurable#registerRowMapper(org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.RowMapperFactory)
097     * @see Configurable#registerColumnMapper(org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.ColumnMapperFactory)
098     * @see Configurable#registerColumnMapper(ColumnMapper)
099     */
100    default <T> ResultIterable<T> mapTo(GenericType<T> type) {
101        return mapTo(QualifiedType.of(type));
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * Maps this result set to a {@link ResultIterable} of the given element type.
106     *
107     * @param type the type to map the result set rows to
108     * @return a {@link ResultIterable} of the given type.
109     * @see Configurable#registerRowMapper(RowMapper)
110     * @see Configurable#registerRowMapper(org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.RowMapperFactory)
111     * @see Configurable#registerColumnMapper(org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.ColumnMapperFactory)
112     * @see Configurable#registerColumnMapper(ColumnMapper)
113     */
114    default ResultIterable<?> mapTo(Type type) {
115        return mapTo(QualifiedType.of(type));
116    }
117
118    /**
119     * Maps this result set to a {@link ResultIterable} of the given qualified element type.
120     *
121     * @param type the qualified type to map the result set rows to
122     * @return a {@link ResultIterable} of the given type.
123     * @see Configurable#registerRowMapper(RowMapper)
124     * @see Configurable#registerRowMapper(org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.RowMapperFactory)
125     * @see Configurable#registerColumnMapper(org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.ColumnMapperFactory)
126     * @see Configurable#registerColumnMapper(ColumnMapper)
127     */
128    default <T> ResultIterable<T> mapTo(QualifiedType<T> type) {
129        return scanResultSet((supplier, ctx) -> {
130            RowMapper<T> mapper = ctx.findMapperFor(type)
131                    .orElseThrow(() -> new NoSuchMapperException("No mapper registered for type " + type));
132            return ResultIterable.of(supplier, mapper, ctx);
133        });
134    }
135
136    /**
137     * Maps this result set to a {@link ResultIterable} of the given element type, using {@link BeanMapper}.
138     *
139     * @param type the bean type to map the result set rows to
140     * @param <T>  the bean type to map the result set rows to
141     * @return a {@link ResultIterable} of the given type.
142     */
143    default <T> ResultIterable<T> mapToBean(Class<T> type) {
144        return map(BeanMapper.of(type));
145    }
146
147    /**
148     * Maps this result set to a {@link ResultIterable} of {@code Map<String,Object>}. Keys are column names, and
149     * values are column values.
150     *
151     * @return a {@link ResultIterable ResultIterable&lt;Map&lt;String,Object&gt;&gt;}.
152     */
153    default ResultIterable<Map<String, Object>> mapToMap() {
154        return map(new MapMapper());
155    }
156
157    /**
158     * Maps this result set to a {@link Map} of {@link String} and the given value class.
159     *
160     * @param <T> the value type
161     * @param valueType the class to map the resultset columns to
162     * @return a {@link Map} of String and the given type.
163     * @see Configurable#registerColumnMapper(ColumnMapper)
164     */
165    default <T> ResultIterable<Map<String, T>> mapToMap(Class<T> valueType) {
166        return scanResultSet((supplier, ctx) -> ResultIterable.of(supplier, GenericMapMapperFactory.getMapperForValueType(valueType, ctx.getConfig()), ctx));
167    }
168
169    /**
170     * Maps this result set to a {@link Map} of {@link String} and the given value type.
171     *
172     * @param <T> the value type
173     * @param valueType the type to map the resultset columns to
174     * @return a {@link Map} of String and the given type.
175     * @see Configurable#registerColumnMapper(ColumnMapper)
176     */
177    default <T> ResultIterable<Map<String, T>> mapToMap(GenericType<T> valueType) {
178        return scanResultSet((supplier, ctx) -> ResultIterable.of(supplier, GenericMapMapperFactory.getMapperForValueType(valueType, ctx.getConfig()), ctx));
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * Maps this result set to a {@link ResultIterable}, using the given column mapper.
183     *
184     * @param mapper column mapper used to map the first column of each row
185     * @param <T>    the type to map the result set rows to
186     * @return a {@link ResultIterable} of type {@code <T>}.
187     */
188    default <T> ResultIterable<T> map(ColumnMapper<T> mapper) {
189        return map(new SingleColumnMapper<>(mapper));
190    }
191
192    /**
193     * Maps this result set to a {@link ResultIterable}, using the given row mapper.
194     *
195     * @param mapper mapper used to map each row
196     * @param <T>    the type to map the result set rows to
197     * @return a {@link ResultIterable} of type {@code <T>}.
198     */
199    default <T> ResultIterable<T> map(RowMapper<T> mapper) {
200        return scanResultSet((supplier, ctx) -> ResultIterable.of(supplier, mapper, ctx));
201    }
202
203    /**
204     * Maps this result set to a {@link ResultIterable}, using the given {@link RowViewMapper}.
205     * This overload only exists to allow RowViewMapper as the type of a lambda expression.
206     *
207     * @param mapper RowViewMapper used to map each row
208     * @param <T>    the type to map the result set rows to
209     * @return a {@link ResultIterable} of type {@code <T>}.
210     */
211    default <T> ResultIterable<T> map(RowViewMapper<T> mapper) {
212        return map((RowMapper<T>) mapper);
213    }
214
215    /**
216     * Reduce the result rows using the given row reducer.
217     *
218     * @param reducer the row reducer.
219     * @param <C> Mutable result container type
220     * @param <R> Result element type
221     * @return the stream of result elements
222     * @see RowReducer
223     */
224    default <C, R> Stream<R> reduceRows(RowReducer<C, R> reducer) {
225        return scanResultSet((supplier, ctx) -> {
226            try (ResultSet rs = supplier.get()) {
227                RowView rowView = new RowViewImpl(rs, ctx);
228
229                C container = reducer.container();
230                while (rs.next()) {
231                    reducer.accumulate(container, rowView);
232                }
233                return reducer.stream(container);
234            } catch (SQLException e) {
235                throw new UnableToProduceResultException(e, ctx);
236            } finally {
237                ctx.close();
238            }
239        });
240    }
241
242    /**
243     * Reduce the result rows using a {@link Map Map&lt;K, V&gt;} as the
244     * result container.
245     *
246     * @param accumulator accumulator function which gathers data from each
247     *                    {@link RowView} into the result map.
248     * @param <K>         map key type
249     * @param <V>         map value type
250     * @return the stream of elements in the container's {@link Map#values()}
251     *         collection, in the order they were inserted.
252     */
253    default <K, V> Stream<V> reduceRows(BiConsumer<Map<K, V>, RowView> accumulator) {
254        return reduceRows((LinkedHashMapRowReducer<K, V>) accumulator::accept);
255    }
256
257    /**
258     * Reduce the results.  Using a {@code BiFunction<U, RowView, U>}, repeatedly
259     * combine query results until only a single value remains.
260     *
261     * @param <U>         the type of the accumulator
262     * @param seed        the {@code U} to combine with the first result
263     * @param accumulator the function to apply repeatedly
264     * @return the final {@code U}
265     */
266    default <U> U reduceRows(U seed, BiFunction<U, RowView, U> accumulator) {
267        return scanResultSet((supplier, ctx) -> {
268            try (ResultSet rs = supplier.get()) {
269                RowView rv = new RowViewImpl(rs, ctx);
270                U result = seed;
271                while (rs.next()) {
272                    result = accumulator.apply(result, rv);
273                }
274                return result;
275            } catch (SQLException e) {
276                throw new UnableToProduceResultException(e, ctx);
277            } finally {
278                ctx.close();
279            }
280        });
281    }
282
283    /**
284     * Reduce the results.  Using a {@code ResultSetAccumulator}, repeatedly
285     * combine query results until only a single value remains.
286     *
287     * @param <U>         the accumulator type
288     * @param seed        the {@code U} to combine with the first result
289     * @param accumulator the function to apply repeatedly
290     * @return the final {@code U}
291     */
292    default <U> U reduceResultSet(U seed, ResultSetAccumulator<U> accumulator) {
293        return scanResultSet((supplier, ctx) -> {
294            try (ResultSet rs = supplier.get()) {
295                U result = seed;
296                while (rs.next()) {
297                    result = accumulator.apply(result, rs, ctx);
298                }
299                return result;
300            } catch (SQLException e) {
301                throw new UnableToProduceResultException(e, ctx);
302            } finally {
303                ctx.close();
304            }
305        });
306    }
307
308    /**
309     * Collect the results using the given collector. Do not attempt to accumulate the
310     * {@link RowView} objects into the result--they are only valid within the
311     * {@link Collector#accumulator()} function. Instead, extract mapped types from the
312     * RowView by calling {@code RowView.getRow()} or {@code RowView.getColumn()}.
313     *
314     * @param collector the collector to collect the result rows.
315     * @param <A> the mutable accumulator type used by the collector.
316     * @param <R> the result type returned by the collector.
317     * @return the result of the collection
318     */
319    default <A, R> R collectRows(Collector<RowView, A, R> collector) {
320        return scanResultSet((supplier, ctx) -> {
321            try (ResultSet rs = supplier.get()) {
322                RowView rv = new RowViewImpl(rs, ctx);
323                A acc = collector.supplier().get();
324
325                BiConsumer<A, RowView> consumer = collector.accumulator();
326                while (rs.next()) {
327                    consumer.accept(acc, rv);
328                }
329
330                return collector.finisher().apply(acc);
331            } catch (SQLException e) {
332                throw new UnableToProduceResultException(e, ctx);
333            } finally {
334                ctx.close();
335            }
336        });
337    }
338
339    /**
340     * Collect the results into a container of the given type. A collector
341     * must be registered for the container type, which knows the element type
342     * for the container. A mapper must be registered for the element type.
343     * <p>
344     * This method is equivalent to {@code ResultBearing.mapTo(elementType).collect(containerCollector)}.
345     * </p>
346     * @param containerType the container type into which results will be collected
347     * @param <R>           the result container type
348     * @return a container into which result rows have been collected
349     */
350    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
351    default <R> R collectInto(Class<R> containerType) {
352        return (R) collectInto((Type) containerType);
353    }
354
355    /**
356     * Collect the results into a container of the given generic type. A collector
357     * must be registered for the container type, which knows the element type
358     * for the container. A mapper must be registered for the element type.
359     * <p>
360     * This method is equivalent to {@code ResultBearing.mapTo(elementType).collect(containerCollector)}.
361     * </p>
362     * <p>
363     * Example:
364     * </p>
365     * <pre>
366     * Map&lt;Long, User&gt; usersById = handle.createQuery("select * from user")
367     *     .configure(MapEntryMappers.class, cfg -&gt; cfg.setKeyColumn("id"))
368     *     .collectInto(new GenericType&lt;Map&lt;Long, User&gt;&gt;() {});
369     * </pre>
370     *
371     * @param containerType the container type into which results will be collected
372     * @param <R>           the result container type
373     * @return a container into which result rows have been collected
374     */
375    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
376    default <R> R collectInto(GenericType<R> containerType) {
377        return (R) collectInto(containerType.getType());
378    }
379
380    /**
381     * Collect the results into a container of the given type. A collector
382     * must be registered for the container type, which knows the element type
383     * for the container. A mapper must be registered for the element type.
384     * <p>
385     * This method is equivalent to {@code ResultBearing.mapTo(elementType).collect(containerCollector)}.
386     * </p>
387     *
388     * @param containerType the container type into which results will be collected
389     * @return a container into which result rows have been collected
390     */
391    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
392    default Object collectInto(Type containerType) {
393        return scanResultSet((rs, ctx) -> {
394            Collector collector = ctx.findCollectorFor(containerType)
395                    .orElseThrow(() -> new NoSuchCollectorException("No collector registered for container type " + containerType));
396            Type elementType = ctx.findElementTypeFor(containerType)
397                    .orElseThrow(() -> new ElementTypeNotFoundException("Unknown element type for container type " + containerType));
398            RowMapper<?> mapper = ctx.findMapperFor(elementType)
399                    .orElseThrow(() -> new NoSuchMapperException("No mapper registered for element type " + elementType));
400            return ResultIterable.of(rs, mapper, ctx).collect(collector);
401        });
402    }
403}
